{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3466784,"name":"Christoforus Cedric Kurniawan","username":"Cedric_2587","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cedric_2587/{size}/255741_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-02T16:59:22.624Z","cooked":"

I’m trying to get my Swerve running in a field-relative mode. The problem I’m running into is that the NavX always reports as calibrating. I’ve implemented a command to zero the gyro when I press a Joystick button, which gets ignored because it’s always calibrating. I used the REV MAXSwerve template, with changes to chassis configuration, CANIds, and the gyroscope. Any help is appreciated!
EDIT: The Gyro-Fixing branch is the one I’m working on.

Here is the Github Repository: (Mainly look at DriveSubsystem and RobotContainer)

github.com

GitHub - Cedric-Kurniawan/CedricDrivetrainCode-Imported: Cedric Drivetrain on WPILib 2025 BETA

Cedric Drivetrain on WPILib 2025 BETA

The first thing I’d try if I was having a NavX issue would be to take the board off the roboRIO and see if the issue persists when using the NavXUI.

I didn’t take the NAVx off the robot, but when I plugged it into it using NavXUI and shook it a bit, it was pretty accurate. “Accurate” meaning it wasn’t continuously calibrating and was giving updated measurements.

When you say that the NavX is continuously calibrating, what happens? Do you see the orange CAL LED steady or flashing? If so, is it a slow or fast blink?

The CAL light stays off. I have a button bound in the code that’s supposed to call the gyro.reset() method which zeroes the heading of the robot. However, every time I do this it gives me the message “NavX: Yaw Reset request ignored - startup calibration is currently in progress.”
I also called the isCalibrating() method in the periodic block, which continuously returned true.
This is the NavX during TeleOp:

image614×786 53.2 KB

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-01-02T23:34:24.792Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":55,"readers_count":54,"score":16.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":477949,"topic_slug":"navx2-mxp-always-calibrating","display_username":"Christoforus Cedric Kurniawan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":56260,"username":"ajs2","name":"Alex","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ajs2/{size}/200927_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63122,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/navx2-mxp-always-calibrating/477949/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3481086,"name":"Christoforus Cedric Kurniawan","username":"Cedric_2587","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cedric_2587/{size}/255741_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-13T17:46:32.401Z","cooked":"

I found the issue, it had nothing to do with the NavX malfunctioning or errors in the code. It turns out, between the 2 pins that are circled, there was a “jumper” that completed a circuit and caused the NavX to calibrate constantly. When we took it off, we were able to change some things in the code for tuning, and our drivetrain drove very well, in a field-oriented fashion. Hope this helps someone else

navXSolution218×558 194 KB

Interesting. I wonder why someone would have put that there.

I suspect that would have stopped SPI communication. So that’s why it would have worked in the NavX UI since it uses USB. Presumably if you had tried USB on the roboRIO it would have worked also.
